programme.title: Wrongful Conviction
programme.desc: It’s estimated that roughly 10,000 people are wrongfully convicted in the U.S. each and every year for crimes they didn’t commit. programme.title: One Small Step
programme.desc: Oftentimes climate change and pollution can seem like unfathomably difficult problems to solve. Out host’s goal is to calm those fears by inviting the audience along with her as she strives to learn how to take action against the problems plaguing our planet. In One Small Step we explore how recycling works, where our waste goes, and how we can fix the planet through our actions as individuals. Hosted by Lucy Biggers, a growing influencer in the sustainability space.

programme.title: Saving Sharks, Raising Awareness
programme.desc: Every hour 10,000 sharks are fished worldwide. Yet, this mythical predator plays a key role in regulating marine life. So now, Jérôme Delafosse has launched The Shark Project - a plea to reconcile humankind with the scary shark - and is traveling the globe to raise awareness about these marvelous animals. Can Jérôme save our sharks from possible extinction?

programme.title: Africa's Primeval Oceans
programme.desc: The scene is the southern tip of Africa. Just off shore, two very different seas meet to form one of the most diverse marine environments on earth. The meeting of icy Atlantic and warm Indian waters not only affect life underwater, they are giant forces that shape the land, climate, and all its creatures. The Portuguese explorer Bartholomew Dias and his crew called it the Cape of Storms.

programme.title: Jess
programme.desc: Environmental philosophy student Jessica is looking to go beyond the surfing experience and see what more the ocean has to offer. Hanli steps up and instructs Jessica in the art of free diving. Her first dive is in a protected cove in a Marine Protected Area in False bay. The episode ends on a high note as Jessica and the crew enjoy an encounter with a pod of pilot whales.

programme.title: Erica
programme.desc: Marine biologist Erica has spent the past eleven years researching the smallest life forms in the ocean, phytoplankton. Through Erica’s eyes, the role of these microorganisms in the marine ecosystem is clarified. Her dream is to swim with humpback whales, so David and his team are determined to make it happen.

programme.title: Monwabisi
programme.desc: Monwa’s life is tied to the sea. However, his relationship to the marine environment is based in fear. David and the crew aim to help him overcome this fear by getting him into the water. Monwa learns to free dive, and once the crew is satisfied that he can handle more, Monwa takes the plunge and swims with blue sharks in an underwater canyon off the coast of the Cape of Good Hope.

programme.title: Life On Us: A Microscopic Safari
programme.desc: Just like planet Earth, our body is composed of diverse landscapes surprising wildlife. This award-winning film offers a unique microscopic safari, encountering the creatures that live, compete, feed, on breed on the surface or in the depths of our body. Some may seem harmful, others are useful and even essential to our survival, but all participate in the biological balance of the human body.

programme.title: Paseka: The Easter Elephant
programme.desc: On Easter morning, a baby elephant is mysteriously abandoned by her herd in the wilds of Botswana’s Okavango Delta. Saved from certain death by a bizarre chain of events, she forces herself into a very unusual, captive elephant herd. This is “Paseka's” story.

programme.title: The Wolf: Marine Mammal
programme.desc: The wolf of British Columbia is on a quest to master fishing and swimming. According to specialists, these wolves may be at the first stage of a process that could turn them into marine mammals.

programme.title: Benelli Presents: Donnie Vincent’s Winds of Adak
programme.desc: In November of 2019, explorer and hunter Donnie Vincent traveled to Adak Island, Alaska. Located at the westernmost end in the Aleutian chain, Adak is wilderness with the exception of a now-abandoned naval base that once housed more than 6,000 people. Winds of Adak chronicles Donnie’s exploration of the island, a hauntingly desolate abandoned military outpost and three unique hunts—caribou, ptarmigan and sea ducks—as the unforgiving elements, the terrain and the Bering Sea test both man and equipment.

programme.title: Behind The Draw S7:E11 "Off The Radar"
The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 2
programme.desc: WPT’s coverage of the Parx Open Poker Classic continues with more nonstop action from the felt where five players are left to fight it out for a spot on the prestigious Champions Cup. Off the felt Tony Dunst brings us more in-depth analysis in another edition of The Raw Deal and we take a look back at one of the best moments from season ten the race to become Player of the Year. Kimberly Lansing anchors while Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten call the plays at the Parx Casino.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 3
programme.desc: It’s down to the final three in the first WPT title of season eleven and there is everything to play for on the felt with a spot on the prestigious Champions Cup at stake. None of these young east coast pros look close to wavering but it is only a matter of time, skill and luck, before the winner is determined. Commentators Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten bring you all the twists and turns in the thrilling conclusion to the Parx Open Poker Classic.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 4
programme.desc: The Legends of Poker is under way and tensions are racking up early in this historic second decade of the World Poker Tour. In his very first WPT event the lone amateur on the felt, Josh Hale, has surmounted a staggering chip-lead but with five talented pros each as eager for the victory, the illustrious Champions Cup could find itself in anyone’s hands. Kimberly Lansing anchors the action while Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten bring you the energetic play by play from the tournament that is just too good to miss.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 5
programme.desc: There are even more twists and turns to be had at the Bicycle Casino where the players’ chip counts rise and fall with dramatic consequences. So far only one player has been eliminated and so five remain to fight for the chance to have their name engraved on the prestigious WPT Champion’s Cup. Off the felt anchor Kimberly Lansing takes a look at previous and current player of the year contenders while poker Hall of Famer Mike Sexton and Hollywood’s own Vince Van Patten guide us though the play to determine the WPT “legend of poker”.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 6
programme.desc: The Legends of Poker is coming to its thrilling conclusion in the third and final hour of WPT’s extended coverage at the Bicycle Casino. There have been some daring plays but it’s time to see whose gamble will pay off on this rollercoaster of a final table. Tony Dunst breaks it down in The Raw Deal while Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten bring us all the surprises in the final hands of this exhilarating competition.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 7
programme.desc: The World Poker Tour has travelled to France for the celebrated Grand Prix de Paris and the final table is looking like a Who’s Who of international pros. Five of the finalists have won big time tournaments across the globe but right now the only amateur on the felt, Matt Salsberg, is in the chip lead. However, it won’t be an easy competition for anyone with season nine Grand Prix de Paris champion Theo Jorgensen up to make poker history by being the first to win the same WPT event twice. Kimberly Lansing anchors as Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten call the action at the Aviation Club de France.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 8
programme.desc: WPT’s coverage of the Grand Prix de Paris resumes at the grandiose Aviation Club de France where five players remain alive, bringing Theo Jorgensen one step closer to making poker history with a second Grand Prix de Paris title however, chip-leading Hollywood producer and so called amateur Matt Salsburg is still standing in his way, along with three gifted and aggressive international pros. Off the felt we take a look back at the best bluff from season ten while Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten call the dynamic action on this exciting final table.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 9
programme.desc: It’s a three way brawl in Paris when Hollywood producer, Matt Salzburg, comes up against two of the most successful poker pros of the last few years ruthless German pro Philipp Gruissem and season nine’s Grand Prix de Paris returning champ Theo Jorgensen. Commentators Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten bring you all the twists and turns in this exciting conclusion to the first televised international title of season eleven.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 10
programme.desc: World Poker Tour ignited the global poker boom with a unique television show based on a series of high-stakes tournaments. WPT events turned Gus Hansen into the Great Dane and Daniel Negreanu into Kid Poker, and created dozens of poker-made millionaires.

programme.title: Jay Stevens - Life is Hilarious
programme.desc: Jay Stevens has been a professional comedian for almost 20 years. Growing up, he was known as a hilarious outgoing character by friends, family, colleagues and those he would meet on a first encounter.

programme.title: Billy Anderson - America's Sweetheart
programme.desc: Born in Texas and raised in Augusta, Georgia ñ Billy Anderson is stand-up comedian currently living in Seattle, Washington. Heís been seen regionally at SketchFest Seattle, The Washington Comedy Festival, Bumbershoot and was a finalist in the 2016 Seattle International Comedy Competition. Outside of the Northwest, Billy has written for Cracked.Com, performed in SF Sketchfest, LaLaFest Los Angeles, the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and as of 2013 he has performed stand-up comedy in every US state. Billy was recently featured on Audibleís ìSounds Like Americaî hosted by Jackie Kashian and the syndicated program ìLaughsî on Fox television.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:BT - My Life As I Know It Now
programme.desc: With an act that crosses all boundaries, B.T. will surely have you rolling with laughter. His physical performance style and charm landed him two performances on NBC's Friday Night Videos and a performance at the prestigious HBO U.S. Comedy Arts Festival. B.T. has also appeared on BET’s Comic View, MTV's The Jenny McCarthy Show, and FOX's The Keenan Ivory Wayans Show.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Shayne Smith - Alligator Boys
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Shayne Smith delivers more stories about everything from a failed robbery to a wrestling match in the New York Subway and even saving the life of a dog in his second original Dry Bar Comedy special, “Alligator Boys."

programme.title: Moody Molavi - Remove Before Flight
programme.desc: The christian comic is married to his high school sweetheart, who later became his stepsister through the marriage of their parents to each other. That’s where the fun begins as Moody skillfully shares his life experiences.

programme.title: Brandon Vestal - Who?
programme.desc: “Brandon Vestal’s low key, deeply personal and honest style has made him a fast favorite in the comedy world, a “Don’t Miss” for college audiences, and a club favorite. He puts on an amazing show and is a definite must see.”

programme.title: Marc Yaffee - Mid-Laugh Crisis
programme.desc: Adopted at birth and confused ever since, Marc takes his audiences on a comedy joyride as he explores his multi-ethnic roots and the culture clashes that fill his world. Marc’s smart but relatable comedy demonstrates a universal appeal that has landed him appearances on PBS, Comics Unleashed, The Latino Laugh Festival and the Showtime special, Goin’ Native. Funny not filthy, Marc serves audiences his original comedy recipe, specially prepared for non- stop laughs. Tasty topics, spicy premises and savory punchlines, are all dished out with a dash of sarcasm and a grain of salt. A regular in Las Vegas, Marc has performed six times overseas for Armed Forces Entertainment and he’s a past winner of Ventura Comedy Festival’s Funniest Person Contest.

programme.title: Mike Brody - Not Afraid of Butterflies
programme.desc: Starting comedy on a whim at an open mic in the year 2000, Mike Brody has since devoted his life to perfecting the delivery of his high-energy act. Bucking the trend of the apathetic comedian, his genuine passion for his craft draws audience members into the unique world of Mike Brody: an affable, clever guy whose life is often derailed by his own neurotic, obsessive-compulsive tendencies. Brody has worked with Jay Pharoah, Dave Attell, Patrice O'Neal, Emo Philips, Joy Behar, Doug Stanhope, Doug Benson, and legendary street performer/madman/savant Wesley Willis. He is the official event comedian for the SyFy Channel’s TV show Ghost Hunters and has also appeared on the nationally syndicated radio program The Bob & Tom Show as well as The Dan Patrick Show.

programme.title: Andy Erikson - Unicorn Style
programme.desc: Andy intertwines silly one-liners with whimsical stories in a playful but thought-provoking way.

programme.title: Ty Barnett - Yep
programme.desc: Ty Barnett, a Chicago native, got his start at Seattle’s Comedy Underground. Whoopi Goldberg called Ty “hilarious” and reviewers have said he is “thought provoking” and “edgy”. All this praise earned him many television appearances. He hosted the Food Network’s Mealin’ and Dealin’, Discovery Family’s Babies Behaving Badly and Beasts Behaving Badly, and appeared in over 15 national commercials. It all began when he was one of the two finalists on the most-watched and Emmy nominated season of Last Comic Standing. Ty went on to multiple Tonight Show appearances where Jay Leno called Ty “one of the funniest comedians working”. He also appeared in HBO’s Bad Boys of Comedy, his own Comedy Central Presents and one-hour special Issues. Ty was named “one to watch” by the Hollywood Reporter. He’s also been seen on the sitcoms Samantha Who, Til Death, Life in Pieces, NickMom Night Out and Tosh.O. His comedy album, Grown Man-Baby Steps is a favorite on Sirius XM.

programme.title: Andy Beningo - Adorable Tough Guy
programme.desc: Over the past decade, Andy Beningo has established himself as one of the hardest working comedians in the business. Performing his clever, "every man" material has led to some 2,700 career performances. Along the way, he has appeared on AXS Gotham Comedy Live, as a final four finalist on CMT's Next Big Comic, and on the Bob and Tom radio show. Beningo's new CD regularly plays on Laugh USA on XM Sirius Radio. He's been hailed for his clean comedy, and was named one of the 40 Best Up and Coming Comedians in the country. He was also named "Best Comedian" by both the Detroit Metro Times and Detroit Hour magazine.

No matter your religion, the intricate sculpture and masonry of this French cathedral is absolutely breathtaking and might leave you feeling a little more spiritual. As you appreciate the beautiful gothic detailing, you can't help but wonder if the 14th century architects and builders may have been guided by a divine hand.

programme.title: Android Cop
programme.desc: In this futuristic, action-packed thriller, a cop and his robotic partner enter the Zone, a forbidden section of the city inhabited by a disease-stricken populace. Together, they discover the real reason everyone is sick, and attempt to stop the illness - with the help of the machine's powerful technology and weaponry.

programme.title: Battle of Los Angeles
programme.desc: In February 1942 US forces engaged an unidentified flying object above Los Angeles. Now almost 70 years later, the alien invaders have returned.

programme.title: Dragonquest
programme.desc: After the ruthless Krill (Brian Thompson) harnesses the power of a deadly fire-breathing dragon, he begins a bloody campaign of world domination. From the ashes of a scorched village, Arkadi (Daniel Bonjour), an unassuming farm boy, embarks on an arduous journey to restore the lost pieces of a mystical amulet -- the only weapon powerful enough to destroy Krill. With the help of swordsman Maxim (Marc Singer) and his squire, Katya (Jennifer Dorogi), Arkadi struggles to save the world.

programme.title: The Time Agent

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E1 | Earth Station
programme.desc: Ex-NASA astronaut Max Levodolinsky readies his piece-of-junk space freighter for his latest transpo run to the Moon—while bickering with Space Traffic Control, his husband, his boss, and… his new pilot-in-training?!?

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E2 | Trainee
programme.desc: Despite his objections, Max is forced to take on fresh astronautics graduate Tommie al-Qasimi. She accidentally unleashes a computer virus that could kill them both after discovering that she can’t stand Max’s taste in music.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E3 | Ransomware
programme.desc: Max and Tommie race against the clock as the virus takes over their ship and thrusts them into the crosshairs of Earth’s orbital defense systems. To Tommie’s dismay, Max makes the most of some very teachable moments.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E4 | Autoreply
programme.desc: Tommie’s boyfriend busts her for using autoreplies to his love letters. But a heart-to-heart about the future reveals a new and even deeper issue between Tommie and Max.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E5 | Replacement
programme.desc: After finding out that Tommie is Max’s replacement, the conversation gets super awkward. But they have to change the subject when their ship gets hit by space junk traveling 10,000 mph.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E6 | Space Junk
programme.desc: Everything in their ship got hit…including Max. Now he and Tommie have to cobble together a plan to save their lives as the ship tumbles out of control. But that doesn’t stop them from continuing to argue about music.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E7 | EVA
programme.desc: They need a spacesuit. Their criminally negligent company didn’t supply one. So now Max is prepping to do a spacewalk using really, really inadvisable substitute gear. Tommie learns what it takes to be a true astronaut.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E8 | Moon Station
programme.desc: Looks like the training portion of the flight is over. Can Tommie show that she’s got the right stuff? Will Max survive the hull-walk from hell? Is the Tsiolkovsky on a one-way trip to oblivion…?
